content.text: üì¶ Amazon order #112-3456789-0123456 shipped. UPS tracking: 1Z999AA10123456784. Delivery: Feb 18

**bills-bot PR #57 ‚Äî Bugbot Review:** Cursor found 3 medium-severity issues in your threading code: thread cache leak (no eviction), concurrent duplicate threads, and missing config validation. Bugbot autofix is running. Check: https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/pull/57
**GitHub (bills-bot PR #57):** Cursor Bugbot fixed 3 threading bugs ‚Äî thread cache eviction, duplicate prevention, config validation. Review and merge or push with `@cursor push bb5f42ea64`.
GitHub: CodeRabbit requested your review on PR #58 (üìù Add docstrings to `feat/ai-conversation-threading`) in bills-bot.

CodeRabbit review on PR #57: Two Biome formatting errors (brace alignment) in src/modules/events.js:194 and src/modules/threading.js:282. Run `biome format` on both files to fix CI. Threading logic is solid overall.

Cursor Bugbot found a medium severity issue in PR #57 (AI conversation threading): thread replies get blocked by channel whitelist because the allowlist check uses thread ID instead of parent channel ID. Needs fixing in src/modules/events.js.

Cursor Bugbot found 4 bugs in PR #59 (mem0 memory feature): 2 HIGH/MEDIUM severity issues that permanently break memory on DELETE responses or transient network errors, plus 2 LOW severity dead code issues. Needs review & fixes. https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/pull/59#pullrequestreview-3805927135

**CodeRabbit review on PR #59 (bills-bot):** Test "should mark as unavailable when client creation fails" is misleading‚Äîexpects success but should test failure path. Also: `mem0ai` version `^2.2.2` doesn't exist; use `^2.1.38` instead. Otherwise LGTM on module structure & coverage.

üêõ **Cursor Bugbot found a bug in bills-bot PR #59** ‚Äî High severity: transient mem0 API errors permanently disable memory for all users until restart. Happens on every message via searchMemories/extractAndStoreMemories. See: https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/pull/59#pullrequestreview-3805981319

üî¥ **HIGH SEVERITY**: Cursor Bugbot found cross-user memory leak in bills-bot PR #59. The mem0 search() call isn't scoping user_id correctly ‚Äî could expose all users' memories. Affects searchMemories() & checkMem0Health(). Fix needed: nest user_id inside filters object. Locations: src/modules/memory.js#L254-L260 & #L183-L188

Cursor Bugbot found 2 issues in PR #59 (User Memory via mem0): (1) HIGH ‚Äî `loadOptOuts()` never called on startup, silencing user privacy choices after restart; (2) LOW ‚Äî delete functions miss error recovery in mem0 API. Both need fixing before merge.
üêõ **bills-bot PR #59 review:** Critical bug flagged ‚Äî `loadOptOuts()` never called on startup, silently violates user privacy choices after restart. Fix suggested in GitHub review.

GitHub review on PR #59 (bills-bot): Missing `markUnavailable()` calls in delete functions would break cooldown mechanism if mem0 fails during delete ops. Needs fix for consistency with other API functions.
GitHub PR review on bills-bot #59: `loadOptOuts()` is exported but never called in production. Opt-out state won't persist across bot restarts. Fix needed in src/index.js:293.

PR #59 review: Critical privacy bug found ‚Äî `loadOptOuts()` not called on startup, violating user opt-out preferences. Also: memory defaults to enabled on config failure. Needs fixes before merge. https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/pull/59#pullrequestreview-3806175439

PR #59 (mem0 memory integration) review complete. **Critical issue**: `loadOptOuts()` never called at startup‚Äîopted-out users' messages sent to mem0 after restart. 1 warning + 2 nitpicks flagged. Changes requested before merge.
PR #60 (Web Dashboard) review complete. Claude flagged 2 warnings (token refresh, Dockerfile context) + 3 nitpicks (bot API auth, guild persistence, middleware naming). Review + address before merge.

üö® PR #59 (bills-bot): Critical bug in mem0 opt-out logic. `loadOptOuts()` never called on startup ‚Äî opted-out users' messages will be sent to mem0 anyway after bot restart. Fix: add `await loadOptOuts()` after `checkMem0Health()` in src/index.js line 293.

PR #59 review: Missing `markUnavailable()` calls in `deleteAllMemories` and `deleteMemory` catch blocks. All other API functions have this for cooldown consistency. If mem0 goes down and delete is first failure, recovery won't engage.

üî¥ **PR #59 Review** (bills-bot mem0 integration): claude[bot] flagged **critical issue** ‚Äî `loadOptOuts()` never called on startup, breaking user opt-out consent after restart. Also: memory defaults to enabled on config failure, unawaited promise in tests, inconsistent error handling. Otherwise solid architecture & test coverage. Needs fixes before merge.

**PR #59 (mem0 integration) ‚Äî Changes Requested**

Critical: `loadOptOuts()` never called on startup ‚Äî opted-out users' messages sent to mem0 anyway (privacy violation). Also 1 warning + 2 nitpicks. https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/pull/59#issuecomment-3905961295

üö® Critical bug in bills-bot PR #59: loadOptOuts() is never called on startup, so opted-out users' messages will silently go to mem0 after restart. Fix: add loadOptOuts() call after checkMem0Health() in startup sequence.

PR #59 (mem0 integration) has critical feedback: loadOptOuts() never called on startup, causing privacy violation‚Äîopted-out users' data sent to mem0 after restart. Also 2 warnings + 2 nitpicks noted. Review: https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/pull/59#pullrequestreview-3806199035
PR #62 (bills-bot): Review nitpick ‚Äî add safeSend.js and sanitizeMentions.js to AGENTS.md Key Files table (lines 145-161). Implementation is solid; just needs doc update.
PR #62 (bills-bot): Review complete. Changes look good, but documentation gap flagged ‚Äî safeSend.js and sanitizeMentions.js missing from Key Files table in AGENTS.md.

GitHub: Review on PR #60 (bills-bot). Warning: Next.js standalone output path may be nested in monorepo‚ÄîCMD ["node", "server.js"] might fail. Check actual output structure and adjust to CMD ["node", "web/server.js"] if needed. https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/pull/60#pullrequestreview-3806266758

PR #60 (Web Dashboard) review: 2 warnings to fix before merge ‚Äî (1) Bot API failure handling in discord.ts:96 needs try/catch, (2) Dockerfile standalone output path may be nested. Plus 3 nitpicks on console logging. Review: https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/pull/60#pullrequestreview-3806267749

PR #60 (Web Dashboard) review complete. Claude flagged 3 issues: Bot API failure in discord.ts:96, Dockerfile output path nesting, console logging. Changes requested. https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/pull/60#issuecomment-3905973261

**GitHub PR Comment** on your repo `777genius/claude-notifications-go` PR #32:
–ò–ª–∏—è commented explaining there's no race condition - `process.waitUntilExit()` blocks the main thread, so the 0.5s delay fires after command completion.

https://github.com/777genius/claude-notifications-go/pull/32#discussion_r2829072170

üìß **GitHub PR Comment** ‚Äî `777genius/claude-notifications-go` PR #32:
